stops.description: Maps GTFS stop IDs to the stop IDs specified in stops.yml, e.g. '20287: 4' to map 20287 in the GTFS data to Albury (#4).

additionalProperties.description: The stop ID, e.g. '48' for Cardinia Road.

parsing.description: Rules which determine which trips are identified as occuring on this line.

additionalProperties.description: The rules for a particular line.

routeIDRegex.description: A list of regular expressions that a trip must have its GTFS route ID match one or more of in order to be to be assigned to this line.

items.description: Regular expression that must match the GTFS route ID for a trip to be assigned to this line.

canDedupeWith.description: The line IDs of lines which trips on this line might be duplicates/subsets of. There is no need to specify the ID of this line.

items.description: The ID of a line which trips on this line might be duplicates/subsets of. There is no need to specify the ID of this line.

ignoreStops.description: Rules for stops which can be ignored when attempting to match trips to this line, e.g. Burnley for the Pakenham/Cranbourne lines.

oneOf.description: The stop ID, e.g. '43' for Burnley.
A rule to define when a stop should be ignored when matching trips to this line.

stop.description: The stop ID, e.g. '43' for Burnley.

ifPresent.description: A list of stop IDs that all must be present in the trip (in any order) for the stop to be ignored.

items.description: The stop ID, e.g. '43' for Burnley.

realtime.description: Configures how realtime data is loaded, if available.

oneOf.description: The URL of the realtime API, e.g. 'https://data-exchange-api.vicroads.vic.gov.au/opendata/v1/gtfsr/metrotrain-tripupdates'.
A list of URLs of realtime APIs.

items.description: The URL of a realtime API, e.g. 'https://data-exchange-api.vicroads.vic.gov.au/opendata/v1/gtfsr/metrotrain-tripupdates'.

apiAuth.description: The method of authentication to use when accessing the realtime API.

refreshInterval.description: The minimum number of seconds between calls to the realtime API.

inactivityTimeout.description: How long realtime data will be refreshed for after the server last notices activity on the website.

staleAfter.description: The maximum number of seconds a result from the realtime API will be recycled.

staticData.description: Describes the method of fetching the static GFTS data.

method.description: The file is loaded from local storage.

path.description: The path of the GTFS zip file on the relay server, e.g. 'offline/gtfs.zip'.

method.description: The file is downloaded from a URL, with no authentication required.

url.description: The URL of the GTFS zip file, e.g. 'https://data.ptv.vic.gov.au/downloads/gtfs.zip'.

method.description: The file is fetched from the relay server (and requires the 'relay-key' header).

url.description: The URL of the GTFS zip file on the relay server, e.g. 'https://vtar.trainquery.com/gtfs.zip'.

refreshHourUtc.description: The hour of the day (in UTC) at which the static data should be refreshed, e.g. '16' for 2am AEST (3am AEDT).

persist.description: Whether to persist the static data to the database.

subfeeds.description: Used when the downloaded zip file contains inner zip files, each with their own independent feeds.

name.description: The name of the subfeed, e.g. 'suburban' or 'regional'.

path.description: The location of the zip file within the outer zip file, e.g. '1/google_transit.zip'.
